thread.title: IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous
thread.title_full: IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous

author: Michael Reschke 812-331-4370 | mreschke@heraldt.com
title: IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous
text:
Previous Next IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
Indiana University Archives | Courtesy PhotoBill Armstrong (wearing hat) and IU President John Ryan, right, join Bob Hope at the homecoming game on October 23, 1971. Hope was performing at the Homecoming Variety Show. IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
Indiana University Archives | Courtesy PhotoTelevision anchor and journalist Jane Pauley, an IU alumna, was parade marshal at the 1978 homecoming. IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
H-T Staff PhotoRed Skelton was parade marshal for the 1983 IU Homecoming. IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
Indiana University Archives | Courtesy PhotoDebra Jackson was probably the first African-American to be Homecoming Queen at Indiana University. IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
The Nov. 5, 1945, issue of Life magazine IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
Indiana University Archives | Courtesy Photo1957 was the last year of the law school/med school football game. This image is scanned from page 83 of the 1958 Arbutus yearbook. IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
The Nov. 5, 1945, issue of Life magazine IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous 
Indiana University Archives | Courtesy PhotoJoel McNally, president of Sigma Delta Chi, escorts playmate Ashlyn Martin to the new fieldhouse for the Sigma Delta Chi blanket hop. According to the Arbutus, the attraction of the playmates at the SDX affair met with general indifference and disappointment. Posted: Saturday, October 17, 2015 1:52 am IU homecoming history from the bizarre to the scandalous By Michael Reschke 812-331-4370 | mreschke@heraldt.com heraldtimesonline.com | 0 comments 
$ID/[None]0000LightBlue@ListHed:The first IU homecoming 
LightBlueDetermining when Indiana University had its first homecoming comes down to the definition of homecoming. The University of Illinois long claimed to have been the originator of the collegiate homecoming, with its first event in 1910. The Illini faithful defined homecoming as “a well-planned, university-sponsored annual alumni event centering on a football game.” That didn’t sound right to Bradley Cook, photograph curator with Indiana University’s Archives and Record Management. kAmr@@< HC@E6 2 A2A6C 5@4F>6?E:?8 `h_g 2D E96 J62C @7 E96 7:CDE 9@>64@>:?8 7@C x?5:2?2 &?:G6CD:EJ] x?
